commit_message:
remove unused common rpc apis

Today neutron.common.rpc has a handful of public constants and functions
that are not used outside of neutron. This patch removes those not
externally used and enhances the rpc.init function to accept extra
RPC exception modules (though it's not used today) to still support
the notion of "extra mods" for RPC.

This patch also paves the way for easier rehoming the module to
neutron-lib.

Change-Id: I51607216a39980c17807dcccace3ab66b549607b

When specifying tags with 'kayobe overcloud post configure --tags <tags>', the
expected plays typically do not run. This seems to be due to an ansible bug,
where if a dynamically created group is referenced before creation, it will
remain empty. See https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/20360.

This change works around this issue by modifying the name of the dynamic groups

commit_message:
Fix use of tags with overcloud post configure

When specifying tags with 'kayobe overcloud post configure --tags <tags>', the
expected plays typically do not run. This seems to be due to an ansible bug,
where if a dynamically created group is referenced before creation, it will
remain empty. See https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/20360.

This change works around this issue by modifying the name of the dynamic groups
used in the post configure playbooks to be unique to each playbook.

Fixes: #138
(cherry picked from commit 77a41a9d0a37acd2d4c25bd7d969d965a9552428)

Change-Id: I7a884f538cfeba9d6b4b990ec445b5ad6f914193
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/82/552482/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Convert role to use a common systemd init role

This removes the systemd service templates and tasks from this role and
leverages a common systemd service role instead. This change removes a
lot of code duplication across all roles all without sacrificing features
or functionality. The intention of this change is to ensure uniformity and
reduce the maintenance burden on the community when sweeping changes are
needed.

In converting this role to use the common systemd_service role a
keystone_service dictionary was created in the defaults main.yml file.
This change follows the pattern of other services.

Change-Id: I70e1f6007d9f88f05ccdc737b210415274580a46
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Prevent a action completion multiple times

If action is completed for second time we must raise and propagate
exception to the client to prevent task completion twice.

Change-Id: I36c5a85da4549ecdf97f6b5996ba436f153dabe8
Closes-Bug: 1743662
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/45/539745/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import eventletfrom mistral.rpc import clients as rpcfrom mistral_lib import actions as ml_actions @mock.patch.object( std_actions.MistralHTTPAction, 'run', mock.MagicMock(return_value='mock') ) def test_retry_async_action(self): retry_wf = """--- version: '2.0' repeated_retry: tasks: async_http: retry: delay: 0 count: 100 action: std.mistral_http url='https://google.com' """ wf_service.create_workflows(retry_wf) wf_ex = self.engine.start_workflow('repeated_retry') self.await_workflow_running(wf_ex.id) with db_api.transaction(): wf_ex = db_api.get_workflow_execution(wf_ex.id) task_ex = wf_ex.task_executions[0] self.await_task_running(task_ex.id) first_action_ex = task_ex.executions[0] self.await_action_state(first_action_ex.id, states.RUNNING) complete_action_params = ( first_action_ex.id, ml_actions.Result(error="mock") ) rpc.get_engine_client().on_action_complete(*complete_action_params) for _ in range(2): self.assertRaises( Exception, rpc.get_engine_client().on_action_complete, *complete_action_params ) eventlet.sleep(5) with db_api.transaction(): task_ex = db_api.get_task_execution(task_ex.id) action_exs = task_ex.executions self.assertEqual(2, len(action_exs)) for action_ex in action_exs: expected_state = states.ERROR \ if action_ex.id == first_action_ex.id else states.RUNNING self.assertEqual(expected_state, action_ex.state)

commit_message:
Fixed the length of a task name

* verified the length of task name while creating a workflow
* fixed bug when join task has a long name
* added the length limitation to the spec docs

Change-Id: I233e6b0f30d42b939757e9c1caf4965ecc375aee
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/94/528494/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_join_with_long_name(self): long_task_name = self.generate_string(255) wf_text = """--- version: '2.0' wf: tasks: task1: on-success: - {0} task2: on-success: - {0} {0}: join: all """.format(long_task_name) wf_service.create_workflows(wf_text) # Start workflow. wf_ex = self.engine.start_workflow('wf', '', {}) self.await_workflow_success(wf_ex.id) # Note: We need to reread execution to access related tasks. with db_api.transaction(): wf_ex = db_api.get_workflow_execution(wf_ex.id) tasks = wf_ex.task_executions task1 = self._assert_single_item(tasks, name='task1') task2 = self._assert_single_item(tasks, name='task2') task3 = self._assert_single_item(tasks, name=long_task_name) self.assertEqual(states.SUCCESS, task1.state) self.assertEqual(states.SUCCESS, task2.state) self.assertEqual(states.SUCCESS, task3.state)

commit_message:
Trivial doc fixes

Trivial patch fixing some doc rendering and readibility problems:

* Use a code box to show the command setting the ovn-cms-options
  external-ids ker in the Open_vSwitch table.
* Fix a bullet point line break in the routing.rst file
* Name and highlight a OVN db table accordingly

Change-Id: I495b095e947b0d0ed4c94d8ddf7c31e027bc4b69
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/28/550128/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: For external connectivity, gateway nodes have to set ``ovn-cms-options`` with ``enable-chassis-as-gw`` in Open_vSwitch table's external_ids column, for example: .. code-block:: console $ ovs-vsctl set open . external-ids:ovn-cms-options="enable-chassis-as-gw"
deleted_lines: For external connectivity, gateway nodes have to set ovn-cms-options with enable-chassis-as-gw in Open_vSwitch table's external_ids column. $ovs-vsctl set open . external-ids:ovn-cms-options="enable-chassis-as-gw"

commit_message:
Cleaning up featureset files from tripleo-ci related variables

This patch removes all tripleo-ci repository related files, from
ovb featuresets, moving them to tripleo-heat-templates

Change-Id: I319e914e8cc0e93aa7f926aca53fd833c1d3efce
Depends-On: I9fd8b8bbcf18d26b1e05d33e2598c0d146814aff

commit_message:
env.py is going around oslo_db

This fixes the issue of alembic going around oslo_db
facade. Now all oslo_db options are processed and passed
to the engine.

Change-Id: I78f6da9112eeade31d5502f73f01b4158a3bf714

subject: Add EXPANDING state to ShardRange
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-09 17:17:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/30a0f18a48241b2596b5d6f98b35eed57e146ff4', 'message': "Add EXPANDING state to ShardRange

Prematurely expanding an acceptor's namespace and bumping its
timestamp [1] was a terrible idea. The acceptor might send this
expanded namespace to other replicas of the root container before the
leader root has replicated the original acceptor namespace with the
same bumped timestamp. This results in the acceptor namespace being
expanded in the root before the donor has cleaved and before the donor
is deleted from the root!

The goal of expanding the acceptor's namespace was to prevent object
updates redirected from the donor during shrinking being considered as
misplaced.  This patch takes a different approach and introduces an
EXPANDING state. Now the acceptor's namespace is left unchanged until
shrinking completes, but its state is moved to EXPANDING. Then, when
shrinking completes, the donor forwards an updated acceptor shard
range to the acceptor which moves it back to ACTIVE state.

This also helps avoid a similar problem when shrinking the final shard
to the root: the root considers itself sharded while it has shard
ranges, so considers any object misplaced and was prone to moving
objects that the final shard range was in the process of cleaving to
the root. Now the root is also put into EXPANDING state when accepting
the final shrinking shard range.

Note: There is still further work needed to ensure that non-leader
roots learn that they are in EXPANDING state *before* any final shard
replica cleaves to them.

[1] Ie65cd4ce0abc98452163f6acdfad3cce5cdd216f

Change-Id: I43cb6285537a24163bfe1245fe15fe1f1393294b

commit_message:
Add EXPANDING state to ShardRange

Prematurely expanding an acceptor's namespace and bumping its
timestamp [1] was a terrible idea. The acceptor might send this
expanded namespace to other replicas of the root container before the
leader root has replicated the original acceptor namespace with the
same bumped timestamp. This results in the acceptor namespace being
expanded in the root before the donor has cleaved and before the donor
is deleted from the root!

The goal of expanding the acceptor's namespace was to prevent object
updates redirected from the donor during shrinking being considered as
misplaced.  This patch takes a different approach and introduces an
EXPANDING state. Now the acceptor's namespace is left unchanged until
shrinking completes, but its state is moved to EXPANDING. Then, when
shrinking completes, the donor forwards an updated acceptor shard
range to the acceptor which moves it back to ACTIVE state.

This also helps avoid a similar problem when shrinking the final shard
to the root: the root considers itself sharded while it has shard
ranges, so considers any object misplaced and was prone to moving
objects that the final shard range was in the process of cleaving to
the root. Now the root is also put into EXPANDING state when accepting
the final shrinking shard range.

Note: There is still further work needed to ensure that non-leader
roots learn that they are in EXPANDING state *before* any final shard
replica cleaves to them.

[1] Ie65cd4ce0abc98452163f6acdfad3cce5cdd216f

Change-Id: I43cb6285537a24163bfe1245fe15fe1f1393294b

commit_message:
3PAR: Add `force detach` support

Add support to force detach a volume from all hosts on 3PAR.

Change-Id: I2ddd0be0d59018db43dca297585d5cb2ee459ede
Closes-bug: #1686745
(cherry picked from commit abca1abc7b01fc1d85af8b9cfa5b646abafc9d4a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/24/550324/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 3.0.40 - Handle force detach case. bug #1686745 VERSION = "3.0.40" if hostname: vluns = self.client.getHostVLUNs(hostname) else: # In case of 'force detach', hostname is None vluns = self.client.getVLUNs()['members'] if hostname is None: hostname = vlun.get('hostname') # vlun with wwn/iqn exists so do not modify host. # TODO(sonivi): since multiattach is not supported for now, # delete only single host, if its not exported to volume. if hosts is not None: if hosts and hosts['members'] and 'name' in hosts['members'][0]: hostname = hosts['members'][0]['name'] if hosts is None: # In case of 'force detach', hosts is None LOG.exception("Exception: %s", e) else: # use the wwn to see if we can find the hostname hostname = self._get_3par_hostname_from_wwn_iqn( wwn, iqn) # no 3par host, re-throw if hostname is None: LOG.exception("Exception: %s", e) raise
deleted_lines: VERSION = "3.0.39" vluns = self.client.getHostVLUNs(hostname) if hosts and hosts['members'] and 'name' in hosts['members'][0]: hostname = hosts['members'][0]['name'] # use the wwn to see if we can find the hostname hostname = self._get_3par_hostname_from_wwn_iqn(wwn, iqn) # no 3par host, re-throw if hostname is None: LOG.error("Exception: %s", e)

commit_message:
Detect openstack_release in kolla-ansible deploy-bifrost

This ensures that the default value of openstack_release - "auto" - is
handled correctly when deploying bifrost.

Change-Id: I71e6fc5a6b82dc5d6788bf093cd079c45d890ffd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/67/550767/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Detect openstack_release variable hosts: bifrost gather_facts: false tasks: - name: Get current kolla-ansible version number local_action: command python -c "import pbr.version; print(pbr.version.VersionInfo('kolla-ansible'))" register: kolla_ansible_version changed_when: false when: openstack_release == "auto" - name: Set openstack_release variable set_fact: openstack_release: "{{ kolla_ansible_version.stdout }}" when: openstack_release == "auto" tags: always

commit_message:
Fix invalid role template generated for ComputeOvsDpdk

Previously fixed for the CephStorage and BlockStorage roles - issue also
occurs for the ComputeOvsDpdk role.
This role also uses_deprecated_params set to 'true' but doesn't have
any deprecated params; changed it to 'false' where appropriate.

Change-Id: Ic843e946ad27380b7f8ce28cd149c88c393918bf
Closes-Bug: 1754633
Related-Bug: 1750828
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/67/551267/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Use www-data user for bifrost nginx log directory
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-06 13:28:49.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/bifrost/tasks/bootstrap.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/2f8c9f83fa78b67879a7be6090bf319ac71ee659', 'message': 'Use www-data user for bifrost nginx log directory

Bifrost uses the www-data user for nginx on debian/ubuntu, and nginx on
other platforms. Kolla-ansible currently uses the nginx user for all
platforms when creating a log directory. This change uses the www-data
user on debian/ubuntu when setting ownership of the bifrost nginx log

Change-Id: I142a158b6f2e8f8a46b684267f6fbb2a6e22a259

commit_message:
Use www-data user for bifrost nginx log directory

Bifrost uses the www-data user for nginx on debian/ubuntu, and nginx on
other platforms. Kolla-ansible currently uses the nginx user for all
platforms when creating a log directory. This change uses the www-data
user on debian/ubuntu when setting ownership of the bifrost nginx log
directory.

Change-Id: I142a158b6f2e8f8a46b684267f6fbb2a6e22a259
Closes-Bug: #1753750
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/76/550076/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: vars: nginx_user: "{{ 'www-data' if is_debian else 'nginx' }}" is_debian: "{{ kolla_base_distro in ['debian', 'ubuntu'] }}" chown {{ nginx_user }}:{{ nginx_user }} /var/log/kolla/nginx'

subject: DNM PoC Enable VNC console access to Ironic nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-16 10:50:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e4514faf2f4598d53fd6698471bc5b9bac08090c', 'message': 'DNM PoC Enable VNC console access to Ironic nodes

This is an early prototype for vnc graphical console access to Nova
instances running on Ironic baremetal nodes.

It is really hacky for now and sole aim is to test this patch

commit_message:
DNM PoC Enable VNC console access to Ironic nodes

This is an early prototype for vnc graphical console access to Nova
instances running on Ironic baremetal nodes.

It is really hacky for now and sole aim is to test this patch
I283ddf5aec64ae4934ec3cf63ee7e357a8a899b2 with real HW.

In general though this work depends on "VNC Graphical console" spec
being approved and implemented in Ironic and its counterpart in Nova.

Change-Id: I3e98b79e01c0b3ade5622ab058101e1348716b82
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/70/398270/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_vnc_console(self, context, instance): """Acquire VNC console information. :param context: request context :param instance: nova instance :return: ConsoleVNC object :raise ConsoleTypeUnavailable: if vnc console is unavailable for the instance """ LOG.debug('Getting VNC console', instance=instance) try: result = self._get_node_console_with_reset(instance) except exception.ConsoleNotAvailable: raise exception.ConsoleTypeUnavailable(console_type='vnc') node = result['node'] console_info = result['console_info'] if console_info["type"] != "vnc": LOG.warning(_LW('Console type "%(type)s" (of ironic node ' '%(node)s) does not support Nova serial console'), {'type': console_info["type"], 'node': node.uuid}, instance=instance) raise exception.ConsoleTypeUnavailable(console_type='vnc') # Parse and check the console url url = urlparse.urlparse(console_info["url"]) try: hostname = url.hostname port = url.port if not (hostname and port): raise AssertionError() except (ValueError, AssertionError): LOG.error(_LE('Invalid VNC console URL "%(url)s" ' '(ironic node %(node)s)'), {'url': console_info["url"], 'node': node.uuid}, instance=instance) raise exception.ConsoleTypeUnavailable(console_type='vnc') return console_type.ConsoleVNC(host=hostname, port=port)

commit_message:
Use mock in test_auth_password.py

In heat, some unit tests still use mox3,
which will make the test speed more slower,
so I decide to remove it.

Change-Id: I68f016053de61ec274636dfe9f83ae57b1b9a84b

added_lines: import mock @mock.patch('keystoneauth1.identity.generic.Password') def test_valid_v2_request(self, mock_password): mock_auth = mock.MagicMock() mock_password.return_value = mock_auth self.patchobject(mock_auth, 'get_access', return_value=TOKEN_V2_RESPONSE) mock_password.assert_called_once_with(auth_url=self.config['auth_uri'], password='goodpassword', project_id='tenant_id1', user_domain_id='domain1', username='user_name1') @mock.patch('keystoneauth1.identity.generic.Password') def test_valid_v3_request(self, mock_password): mock_auth = mock.MagicMock() mock_password.return_value = mock_auth self.patchobject(mock_auth, 'get_access', return_value=TOKEN_V3_RESPONSE) mock_password.assert_called_once_with(auth_url=self.config['auth_uri'], password='goodpassword', project_id='tenant_id1', user_domain_id='domain1', username='user_name1') @mock.patch('keystoneauth1.identity.generic.Password') def test_request_with_bad_credentials(self, mock_password): mock_password.side_effect = keystone_exc.Unauthorized(401) mock_password.assert_called_once_with(auth_url=self.config['auth_uri'], password='badpassword', project_id='tenant_id1', user_domain_id='domain1', username='user_name1')
deleted_lines: from keystoneauth1.identity import generic as ks_auth from keystoneauth1 import session as ks_session import mox def test_valid_v2_request(self): mock_auth = self.m.CreateMock(ks_auth.Password) self.m.StubOutWithMock(ks_auth, 'Password') ks_auth.Password( auth_url=self.config['auth_uri'], password='goodpassword', project_id='tenant_id1', user_domain_id='domain1', username='user_name1').AndReturn(mock_auth) m = mock_auth.get_access(mox.IsA(ks_session.Session)) m.AndReturn(TOKEN_V2_RESPONSE) self.m.ReplayAll() self.m.VerifyAll() def test_valid_v3_request(self): mock_auth = self.m.CreateMock(ks_auth.Password) self.m.StubOutWithMock(ks_auth, 'Password') ks_auth.Password(auth_url=self.config['auth_uri'], password='goodpassword', project_id='tenant_id1', user_domain_id='domain1', username='user_name1').AndReturn(mock_auth) m = mock_auth.get_access(mox.IsA(ks_session.Session)) m.AndReturn(TOKEN_V3_RESPONSE) self.m.ReplayAll() self.m.VerifyAll() def test_request_with_bad_credentials(self): self.m.StubOutWithMock(ks_auth, 'Password') m = ks_auth.Password(auth_url=self.config['auth_uri'], password='badpassword', project_id='tenant_id1', user_domain_id='domain1', username='user_name1') m.AndRaise(keystone_exc.Unauthorized(401)) self.m.ReplayAll() self.m.VerifyAll()

removes the associated downloads and configuration.

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary locks

All of these operations (fetch from dict and modify dict) are
already atomic in python implementations with GIL. These locks are
unnecessary.

Change-Id: I70a8efab61f4570ee00e04021949517fd4e6a20d
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

commit_message:
Update ZooKeeper from 3.4.9 to 3.4.10

3.4.10 is the current stable release of Zookeeper.

sha1sum is from:

http://www-eu.apache.org/dist/zookeeper/stable/
zookeeper-3.4.10.tar.gz.sha1

Change-Id: I745f3d5949be66f8463e1e1a3d02b25d2606d256
Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-containers

commit_message:
kernel: make ExtraKernelModules and ExtraSysctlSettings role-specific

Allow to configure extra Kernel modules and extra sysctl settings per role
and not only global to the whole deployment.
The two parameters that can be role-specific are ExtraKernelModules and
ExtraSysctlSettings.

Change-Id: Iaafd0133df7ecd01a338f1b4deb3b159c2d9c6f1
(cherry picked from commit da1ed3d19c54b5f60fdc883fd4f11f613914c854)

We shouldn't notify the main event queue when publishing logs: those are

Closes-Bug: #1754061
"}]
commit_message:
Don't notify zaqar in publish_ui_logs_to_swift

We shouldn't notify the main event queue when publishing logs: those are
run in a cron, so we're not waiting for messages from it. When it fails,
it can interrupt regular workflows.

Change-Id: Ifb17352c4a89e2a1ea7c014cf64a586b4e5a2859
Closes-Bug: #1754061

commit_message:
Use UCA for functional and fullstack tests

Some features like ct_clear are implemented in OVS 2.6 but Xenial uses
OVS 2.5.2. Devstack by default enables Ubuntu Cloud Archives and this
patch enables UCA on the gate for functional and fullstack tests with
openvswitch 2.8.

Change-Id: I026abf016a0024e235825f18e280c35d01706bbb

commit_message:

commit_message:
Fix queue create/update without metadata modification

When metadata is not modified in queue create/update, the operation
failed. This problem was caused by the patch that changing `$scope`
handling[1]. This patch fixes it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/497127/

Change-Id: Ia7a524c5991c63caa24be7effc1a3bdfb8f914c4
Closes-Bug: #1647995
(cherry picked from commit 89e908c5a2eb968230a799b48fff2c88c1fb1702)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar-ui refs/changes/26/552426/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Workaround for Bifrost being unable to write to /etc/hosts

Bifrost cannot modify /etc/hosts from within a container, so add a
host entry during bootstrap.

This was previously fixed by Ied378b4dd755788e75ad1814cecb5700732ba83e
but the logic in bifrost was changed [1], making it out of sync with
kolla-ansible, and triggering a write to /etc/hosts. This change applies
the new logic in bifrost to kolla-ansible, ensuring that the file will
not need to change in the container.

Longer term we should look at ways to make bifrost less eager to modify
/etc/hosts, accepting any file that will work for RabbitMQ.

[1]
https://github.com/openstack/bifrost/commit/60b9a9917e987e321b97b0f611fc2c77813be8b0

Change-Id: I0ee05feae3630435b2ec52cfeddf33647a974ee0
Closes-Bug: #1661009
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/98/549798/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(mgoddard): The following task was lifted from a Bifrost play # (playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/tasks/bootstrap.yml). Because # Bifrost cannot modify /etc/hosts from within the container we must do it # here. - name: "Ensure /etc/hosts has good defaults" lineinfile: dest: "/etc/hosts" regexp: "{{ item.regexp }}.*({{ ansible_hostname }}|localhost).*" line: "{{ item.contents }}" with_items: - { regexp: '^127\.0\.0\.1', contents: '127.0.0.1 {{ ansible_hostname }} {{ ansible_fqdn }} localhost' } - { regexp: '^::1', contents: '::1 {{ ansible_hostname }} {{ ansible_fqdn }} localhost ipv6-localhost ipv6-loopback' } become: true
deleted_lines: # NOTE(mgoddard): The following two tasks were lifted from the Bifrost plays. # Because Bifrost cannot modify /etc/hosts from within the container we must # do it here. - name: "RabbitMQ - Testing if hostname is defined in /etc/hosts" command: grep -i "{{ ansible_hostname }}" /etc/hosts ignore_errors: yes register: test_grep_fix_hostname - name: "RabbitMQ - Fixing /etc/hosts" command: sed -i 's/localhost/{{ ansible_hostname }} localhost/' /etc/hosts when: test_grep_fix_hostname.rc != 0 become: True

commit_message:
Drop tempest-lib from g-r

It has been deprecated for some time already and has
seen its last release in 2016, so I'd say it is time
to cleanup the cruft.

Deprecation notice is the last patch that merged
into that git repo - see
https://github.com/openstack/tempest-lib/blob/master/README.rst
Everything else get's -2'ed and abandoned. so I don't think
it is a good dependency for OpenStack anymore.

Closes-Bug: #1753969
Change-Id: Ib4d550870bbdb85fb2a9df20d295015dd3f03597

commit_message:
Don't set mysql_service_name for bifrost

Bifrost will determine the name of the service for MySQL based on the OS
distro if mysql_service_name is not set. Setting it explicitly in
extra-vars was causing problems on systems that use mariadb.

Change-Id: I892b1c9cf636b9dfc1bacc92e1e2f0d066018260
Closes-Bug: #1753522

[WIP] Move legacy jobs to project

This patch implements first step in zuulv3 migration guide [1]:
Move jobs to cloudkitty repo

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html#legacy-job-migration-details

Change-Id: Ia0ac51377de73bc2470f27a26452225e7cf1f447

commit_message:
Fix queue create/update without metadata modification

When metadata is not modified in queue create/update, the operation
failed. This problem was caused by the patch that changing `$scope`
handling[1]. This patch fixes it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/497127/

Change-Id: Ia7a524c5991c63caa24be7effc1a3bdfb8f914c4
Closes-Bug: #1647995

commit_message:
Adding container support for VNF

This spec proposes adding support for container in Tacker. It proposes to
spawn a VNF as a container rather than a VM.

Change-Id: I27a27b1a364118380b6804b5ea6ce73a0ad2428d
blueprint: containerised-vnfs
Co-Authored-By: Bharath Thiruveedula <bharath_ves@hotmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker-specs refs/changes/33/397233/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================== Containarised VNFs =================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tacker/+spec/containerised-vnfs Currently, a VNF is created as a virtual machine. With containers gaining momentum and having advantage to virtual machines, it seems optimal to introduce containers in Tacker. VNFs could be spwaned as a docker containers instead of VMs. This spec describes the steps involved to incorporate this feature to Tacker. Problem description ------------------- VMs are heavy weight, takes time to spawn and add latency of a guest OS. They do not completely solve the resource under-utilization issue. The guest OS still takes too much of host's space limiting the number of VMs a host can support. Network function virtualised in a VM faces the above issues too. This demands a higher configuration systems to support more VNFs depending on the VNF requirements. This spec proposes to support network functions as a container. Containers are light weight, spawn up quickly and runs on host OS. Physical system's configuration requirements are relaxed too. More VNFs as a container could be run on the server as compared to running as a VM. Proposed change --------------- Magnum will be used for conatiners management and orchestration. Kuryr will be used for networking of containers. There are two options to implement this currently. 1. Call Magnum APIs via Heat. Heat resources corresponding to Magnum resources are available. 2. Add Magnum as an infra driver, just like Heat, and call its API directly from Tacker. This would require adding a Magnum translator to convert TOSCA template to Dockerfile. Alternatives ------------ Zun could be used instead of Magnum to spawn a container. But Zun is not mature enough at the moment. Data model impact ----------------- A new field needs to be added to VNFD and VNF tables indicating whether it is a VM or a container template or VNF respectively. REST API impact --------------- 'Create VNF' API will have a "type" parameter to indicate whether the VNF will be a VM or a container. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- 'Create VNF'command in tackercleint will have 'type' parameter to distinguish between the type of VNF to be spawned i.e. a VM or a container. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Janki Chhatbar <jchhatba@redhat.com> Other contributors: Bharath Thiruveedula <bharath_ves@hotmail.com> Work items ---------- 1. Add 'type' parameter to tackerclient 2. Add 'type' to API 3. Add 'type' field to VNF and VNFD tables 4. Add translator logic to map Heat resources to Magnum resources 5. Add functional test cases 6. Add usage guide on using this feature Dependencies ============ Magnum Kuryr Testing ======= Add functional and unit tests for this functionality. Documentation Impact ==================== User-guide will be provided. References ========== None

added_lines: from openstack_dashboard.test import helpers from senlinclient.v1 import client as senlin_client class SenlinApiClientTests(test.SenlinTestsMixin, helpers.APITestCase): def test_senlinclient(self): senlinclient = api.senlin.senlinclient(self.request) self.assertIsNotNone(senlinclient) self.assertIsInstance(senlinclient, senlin_client.Client)

commit_message:
Improve healthchecks

To help deployers with openstack ansible, we add these playbooks
on the deploy guide path. It makes it easier for everyone
to know the cause for failures: the common one would be caught
and documented.

Change-Id: Ia7cb6327dc887c859404930e238bd5462e2bbc72
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/26/547426/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- # Copyright 2018, Rackspace US, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. # This playbook is meant to run after setup-hosts. # To succeed, it expects the setup-hosts playbook to have run successfuly. # Ensuring the openstack hosts are well setup # Ensure the containers are properly setup - name: Ensuring hosts good behavior hosts: hosts gather_facts: no tasks: - name: Check the right role code was used debug: msg: "To be implemented" verbosity: 1 # TODO(evrardjp): Add nspawn checking - name: Looking for dnsmasq process command: pgrep dnsmasq changed_when: false when: container_tech | default('lxc') == 'lxc' - name: Ensuring containers creation, connection and good behavior hosts: all_containers gather_facts: yes tasks: - name: Ensure the physical host has all the proper interfaces defined assert: that: - item.value.bridge in hostvars[physical_host]['ansible_interfaces'] with_dict: "{{ container_networks }}" - name: Check if dns resolution and external connectivity is fine get_url: url: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/openstack-ansible/plain/ansible-role-requirements.yml dest: /tmp/osa-master-requirements - name: Ensure settings are not wrong with the usual suspects issues before trying to deploy infra hosts: haproxy_all gather_facts: yes tasks: - name: Checking that the LB vips are well configured. assert: that: - external_lb_vip_address != internal_lb_vip_address msg: | External and Internal LB vip addresses are the same. Run with -e vipcheck=False if you want to bypass this check. when: - vipcheck | default(True) | bool - inventory_hostname == ansible_play_hosts[0] - name: Checking that vip nics are well configured assert: that: - item in ansible_interfaces msg: "Misconfigured keepalived IP, the carrying interface {{ item }} doesn't exist" with_items: - "{{ haproxy_keepalived_external_interface }}" - "{{ haproxy_keepalived_internal_interface }}" when: - groups['haproxy_all'] | length > 1 - name: Checking that vip address is well formed assert: that: - item | ipaddr('address') msg: "Misconfigured keepalived: The vip {{ item }} is not an address" with_items: - "{{ haproxy_keepalived_internal_vip_cidr }}" - "{{ haproxy_keepalived_external_vip_cidr }}" when: - groups['haproxy_all'] | length > 1

commit_message:
Homogenize the topics conf variable on templates

In several templates the variable topics is configured
between simple quotes.
It is better to remove them to use the openstack default value.

Change-Id: I418c714240b38b2853a5c746203eac31588e841a

commit_message:
Remove cap on websocket-client

The new version contains support for Kubernetes core Workloads API.

To update to this version we need to:
a. Remove the cap on websocket-client
b. Alter the constrained version of websocket-client - to be co-installable
with openstack libs (python-zunclient) and kubernetes
c. Raise the minimum acceptable version fro kubernetes - to be compatible
with the wider range of websocket-client

a follow-on commit to do b and c after zuneclient is release will follow

Change-Id: I8f65ca4ffc1cab7a7eb0708884ee311a6aeb0e26
Signed-off-by: Matthew Thode <mthode@mthode.org>

commit_message:
Filter out conntrack entries with unknown protocol

This patch updates the legacy conntrack driver to skip listing
(and deleting) any conntrack entries  with an unknown protocol.

The conntrack driver currently handles sessions for
TCP/UDP/ICMP/ICMP6 protocols only.

Change-Id: I53439c3f614d1a6ae7b3d679c018065d700316c5
Closes-Bug: #1753507

commit_message:
murano internal authentication needs /v3

Missing [murano_auth] with auth_uri ending in '/v3' leads to
keystone authentication failures - murano uses old v2 keystone.

Change-Id: I41846ac4fa78da90e02d91e8d1cec7405178f7df
Closes-Bug: #1753480

subject: [WIP]Fix update server's wrong meta when update concurrently
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-17 08:44:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/de308969ed3e3efe8c28add4e57fad5308eebaab', 'message': "[WIP]Fix update server's wrong meta when update concurrently

TODO: add unit test cases.

In the current implementation, when multiple update server's
metadata API take place concurrently, problem will occour,
details can be found in bug discription.

The root reason of this error is:
1. we get origin meta in api code, use this as baseline and
update the increment change to origin meta, see ref[1].
2. but we get the db record again in db, and use the db
record as baseline, see ref[2].
Obviously, the baseline of change one and origin one is not
unified, finally, we get the wrong result when update concurrently.

This patch try to fix this error, we try to use original meta or
sys-meta as baseline to update meta.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/0fc702cc081bab09424f3d63f242ff8c8f1215ce/nova/compute/api.py#L4019
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/0fc702cc081bab09424f3d63f242ff8c8f1215ce/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L2741

Change-Id: I184c4530e15323746cee0fac61c6fe932c214913

commit_message:
[WIP]Fix update server's wrong meta when update concurrently

TODO: add unit test cases.

In the current implementation, when multiple update server's
metadata API take place concurrently, problem will occour,
details can be found in bug discription.

The root reason of this error is:
1. we get origin meta in api code, use this as baseline and
update the increment change to origin meta, see ref[1].
2. but we get the db record again in db, and use the db
record as baseline, see ref[2].
Obviously, the baseline of change one and origin one is not
unified, finally, we get the wrong result when update concurrently.

This patch try to fix this error, we try to use original meta or
sys-meta as baseline to update meta.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/0fc702cc081bab09424f3d63f242ff8c8f1215ce/nova/compute/api.py#L4019
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/0fc702cc081bab09424f3d63f242ff8c8f1215ce/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L2741

Change-Id: I184c4530e15323746cee0fac61c6fe932c214913
Co-Authored-By: Zhenyu Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>
Closes-bug: #1650188

commit_message:
remove unnecessary conf imports

There are a bunch of files that define CONF but don't ever reference
it. This cleans that up, removing unnecessary imports.

In order to get flake8 to pass I also had to remove some (unrelated)
unused imports from touched files.

Change-Id: Ib96ebeeb5e4bfedb20afb02c56da1521df9fac4f

commit_message:
Restore rally job

Due to various changes in OpenStack and Rally CI, mistral-rally-task job
became broken.

Unfortunately, it took much time for Rally team to finish some
stuff(sorry for that) and migrate jobs for native Zuul V3 format.

This patch restores mistral-rally-task job which inherits from the job
which Rally team runs constantly on all inner patches.

Change-Id: Ia7177af9b3e1aaacf555f5c472c4f0471b796930

"}]
commit_message:
DPDK deployment fails when there is no deprecated parameters

When no deprecated parameters in role_data and enabling flag
'uses_deprecated_params', deployment fails as the parameter_groups
has no parameters added to computeovsdpdk-role file. As there are
no deprecated parameters for this role, this flag should be disabled.
Closes-Bug: #1754546

Change-Id: I95c7683b56c82c2cd8d67863867ed8a4f617d1f0

commit_message:
Add release note for keystone v2 removal

It is possible that some users might be slightly affected by this
change. Add a release note about the removal of keystone v2 in queens.

Since Queens already went out the door, this change is being proposed
only to the stable/queens branch so that it is properly rendered in the
Queens release notes page.

Change-Id: I9aaf7c9eff9000401bca9d4884675f0b1d9aeb3e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/31/552031/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - > [`blueprint removed-as-of-queens <https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/removed-as-of-queens>`_] Support for all Identity V2 APIs, with the exception of the EC2 v2 API, has been removed from keystone.

commit_message:
Tabs of network/router detail page pluggable

Network related horizon plugins would like to add a tab to
the network/router detail panels.
This commit make such tabs pluggable.

Change-Id: I42b28fcde6d5ed944ffd4272af2353ca3cc08e6c
Closes-Bug: #1746754

subject: Improve mocking in REST API tests (test_cinder)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-13 03:27:37.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/test/unit/api/rest/test_cinder.py', 'openstack_dashboard/api/base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/64d5ba8515a0ff49f510bf1f2b572a57fab7a6e7', 'message': 'Improve mocking in REST API tests (test_cinder)

The current REST API tests have a lot of rooms to be improved like:
- mocking the whole module of the API wrapper
- Use test_data.cinder_data
- Use response.json attribute to decode responses as much as possible

APIResourceWrapper.to_dict() method of openstack_dashboard.api.base
is changed to refer attributes of an object itself instead of
self._apiresource. There is a case where APIResourceWrapper class
defines its own attributes and such attributes should be used in
to_dict() method. If self._apiresouce is referred these attributes
are not considered. We need to consume attributes of a class object
itself. It helps us write unit tests using sample test data.

Change-Id: I5b0c3bb52d97f377c6e5fe2b9a4ace2931114ab0
Partial-Bug: #1752917
'}]
commit_message:
Improve mocking in REST API tests (test_cinder)

The current REST API tests have a lot of rooms to be improved like:
- mocking the whole module of the API wrapper
- Use test_data.cinder_data
- Use response.json attribute to decode responses as much as possible

APIResourceWrapper.to_dict() method of openstack_dashboard.api.base
is changed to refer attributes of an object itself instead of
self._apiresource. There is a case where APIResourceWrapper class
defines its own attributes and such attributes should be used in
to_dict() method. If self._apiresouce is referred these attributes
are not considered. We need to consume attributes of a class object
itself. It helps us write unit tests using sample test data.

Change-Id: I5b0c3bb52d97f377c6e5fe2b9a4ace2931114ab0
Partial-Bug: #1752917

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style guidelines
they recommend to import only modules. [1]: "Do not import objects, only modules".

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/0.10.3/

Change-Id: I05ad55cc6301429140069e4ebcb86e6a41c380b5

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ia97c552e3d11495680275903da5dd4fb711aff87

commit_message:
Add same launch instance error handling as image to instance

Previously, when launching an instance with an instance snapshot rather
than with an image, the error handling was not as pleasant. I.e. the
volume size was not automatically set to the minimum size and the error
message would only appear after attempting to launch an instance. This
is a small patch that addresses this and makes the user experience more
friendly.

Change-Id: Ib694f66c74e90ee2e15201673de953c08cf10122
Closes-bug: #1752360
(cherry picked from commit 3233de8f0d13ad9e0223da9f1cf895aa30a6177e)

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-03 13:51:52.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/masakari-monitors/commit/e6ecb5623214d88bbe36e038f2a398743b436726', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I76939b6c0f1d866b5bb80e169226887ac40758dd
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I76939b6c0f1d866b5bb80e169226887ac40758dd

commit_message:
Specify 'become' for only neccesary tasks (all other roles)

Add become to only neccesary tasks in roles:

- aodh
- barbican
- bifrost

commit_message:
Add release note about event retry

Change-Id: I12cbe5e248c4f55ea20f22afd2cc4fa88e100e0e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/blazar refs/changes/86/548586/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Event actions are now retried if they fail. This allows events to be executed successfully even if they are scheduled at the same time as an API operation such as update lease. Operators can configure the number of retries using the [manager]/event_max_retries configuration value.

commit_message:
Activate new healthchecks

In previous patches link to appropriate scripts were not added.

commit_message:
Add stable/queens to the periodc-stable pipelines for some projects

The periodic-stable/networking-bagpipe/stable/queens/openstack-tox-py27
job filed with[1]:

    ERROR! /home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn not found

As did[2], [3] and [4]

I understand that using zuul-cloner isn't supported but switching to
tox-siblings hasn't happened yet in the mean time I assume this job
failed as stable/queens wasn't listed under branches.

So I admit I'm taking a wild guess here.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic-stable/git.openstack.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/stable/queens/openstack-tox-py27/5a05200/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-03-08_06_07_43_938740

commit_message:
Tabs may not appear in angular instance wizard

In the launch instance wizard, when a specific tab is disabled
(by example not matching the required policy) then some other
tabs may not be displayed.

After a long analysis :
Each tabs resolved itself if it should or shouldn't be displayed
(ready or not). But at the first rejection (first tab ready=false),
the wizard will display all "ready" tabs without waiting for other
tabs to be ready or not.
If all tabs had been resolved before the first reject, the display
is correct, but sometimes when the reject finishes first, a lot of
tabs are missing.

This bugs is not current because I think it is not common to hide tabs.

Closes-Bug: #1752604
Change-Id: I67f96092d9f82374087fc0c87b857292e188b675

subject: Update tox.ini
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-11 01:34:52.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/d885d9e5f2be96831505a7d123ec1459eddce6f6', 'message': 'Update tox.ini

- Drop tox envs for Django 1.10 or older.
- Drop tox env py27dj111 as Django 1.11 is our primary version
  and it is covered by py27.
- Ensure Django 2.0 is installed in py35dj20 and manage-py35dj20.
  The current install command potentially installs Django 2.1 or
  later if alpha version is released. It is better to ensure
  2.0.x is installed.

Change-Id: I85cbb61da9496313ae1633ec94b85702b434b122
'}]
commit_message:
Update tox.ini

- Drop tox envs for Django 1.10 or older.
- Drop tox env py27dj111 as Django 1.11 is our primary version
  and it is covered by py27.
- Ensure Django 2.0 is installed in py35dj20 and manage-py35dj20.
  The current install command potentially installs Django 2.1 or
  later if alpha version is released. It is better to ensure
  2.0.x is installed.

Change-Id: I85cbb61da9496313ae1633ec94b85702b434b122
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/28/551728/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: envlist = pep8,py27dj{18,19,110},py35,releasenotes,npm[testenv:py27dj18] commands = pip install -U django>=1.8,<1.9 {[unit_tests]commands} [testenv:py27dj19] commands = pip install -U django>=1.9,<1.10 {[unit_tests]commands} [testenv:py27dj110] commands = pip install -U django>=1.10,<1.11 {[unit_tests]commands} [testenv:py27dj111] commands = pip install -U django>=1.11,<2.0 {[unit_tests]commands} pip install -U --pre django pip install -U --pre django

commit_message:
Optionally drop common prefixes in swift-*-info output

Add a --drop-prefixes flag to swift-account-info, swift-container-info,
and swift-object-info. This makes the output between the three more
consistent.

Change-Id: I98252ff74c4983eaad0a93d9a9fc527c74ffce68

commit_message:
Remove meta job map for aio->aio_lxc

The job map was only required to transition from pike to
queens when the scenario was changed.

The patch also correctly sets the scenario for the jobs
to the correct value.

Change-Id: I384df79df83b04adfd7ba002ce54b9044c6df5e1

subject: Catch an error when pool creation failed for ceph
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-05 12:39:22.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/ceph_pools.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/59d33d39887ed1efe5b8833473abcdd2735b0e98', 'message': 'Catch an error when pool creation failed for ceph

Ceph mon have a configure about "mon_max_pg_per_osd"
and default value is 300.
When pgs per osd is exceeded, pool creation will be failed.
But kolla-ansible ignoring this, so user may difficult to find
a main reason for the failure.
We need to catch an error when pool creation is failed.

Change-Id: I92493584faad9bc550fdeeb96b827537daafd0b8
Closes-Bug: #1747414
'}]
commit_message:
Catch an error when pool creation failed for ceph

Ceph mon have a configure about "mon_max_pg_per_osd"
and default value is 300.
When pgs per osd is exceeded, pool creation will be failed.
But kolla-ansible ignoring this, so user may difficult to find
a main reason for the failure.
We need to catch an error when pool creation is failed.

Change-Id: I92493584faad9bc550fdeeb96b827537daafd0b8
Closes-Bug: #1747414

commit_message:
Add 'openstack_vim_id' to Kubernetes VIM's config file

When integrating with kuryr-kubernetes, Tacker almost treats Pods as
VMs. To retrieve neutron port id of Pods or Services, we should provide
OpenStack VIM which is associated with Kubernetes VIM.

Change-Id: I278d5deb7f1f35dd2359322df1da8261d558ed2d

commit_message:
Modify the test of 'test_delete_success'

using mock.MagicMock() to mock container will make
"teardown_network" is False, which make the test
Cannot fully cover the whole process. It is better
to use mock_default_container.

Change-Id: Ief7035acd09f81b9ea6dfa8aa296d6f638b3a293

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I133002dd6c6dcc1c148d23d936883cf4a750f4ac

commit_message:
Support creating VNFFG with no flow-classifier

According to SFC RFC standard, the chains should be decoupled
from classifiers.

In Networking-sfc the chains and classifiers are completely
decoupled. This patch lets user can do it by allow creating
VNFFG with no flow-classifier.

User can use "tosca-vnffgd-no-classifier-sample.yaml" to create
VNFFG with no flow-classifier. User also have the ability to
add flow-classifiers through updating VNFFG with
"tosca-vnffgd-sample.yaml" in vnffgd tosca templates folder.

This patch only support Forwarding path with type
"tosca.nodes.nfv.FP.TackerV2". Tacker also support altering the
direction of the traffic in forwarding path, update new
forwarding path, add, remove and update flow-classifers though
updating VNFFG.

For more information: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531817

Change-Id: Ice2f0f03f7a90f4fefdee751283ff26b9c037d87
Closes-Bug: #1745818
(cherry picked from commit a11d9a194a696911c4778a84ddf000db26dfa3bf)

commit_message:
Add Horizon UIs for managing Kubernetes VIMs

- This patch implements the Horizon UIs for Kubernetes VIM type
- It also add the cert_verify option which is required by
tackerclient when registering OpenStack VIM
- Installation:
    - Go to tacker-horizon dir: `cd /opt/stack/tacker-horizon`
    - Checkout this patch: `git fetch https://git.openstack.org/openstack/tacker-horizon refs/changes/79/545279/20 && git checkout FETCH_HEAD`
    - Collectstatic and compress: `./manage.py collectstatic --noinput && echo yes | ./manage.py compress`
    - Restart apache2: `sudo systemctl restart apache2`
- Screenshot:
    - https://pasteboard.co/HbbCoZp.png
    - https://pasteboard.co/HbbGiYs.png

Change-Id: I3c4cf6e6a245a13e140740209d190c33446074c4
Implements: blueprint k8s-vim-horizon-ui

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

For more detials information, please refer to:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Change-Id: Ie9e04cf08b15fa47eb50cf9bccbf1942de7bfba2

commit_message:
Add an openSUSE Tumbleweed devstack non-voting check job

This adds the necessary fixes to pass a devstack run
on openSUSE Tumbleweed. Also removes opensuse 42.2 as it
is EOL for some time already and no longer actively tested
in the OpenStack infra.

Depends-On: I1b68c08c07cf6653ea58506f738cbe0054b38f3a
Change-Id: I2894482deef063fd02b0818c695a2ddbf6767039

commit_message:
Add recordset scenario test

There is a need to run the recordset tests without using admin credential,
an existing zone, which shall be configured as the precondition in
tempest.conf, will be used to test the creation and deletion of
recordsets.

Change-Id: I3ae09176d410b9ed6437b8e55ace67cad0d5b5b9

commit_message:
Remove the deprecated "giturl" option

openstackdocstheme[1], we do not need giturl option anymore.

commit_message:
multinode, multitenant grenade votes in gate

The multinode, multitenant grenade job seems healthy again, lets
have it vote in gate as well as in check.

This is a follow up to Iab5fc999fcfa427549192ec73bd076a588f37e20.

Change-Id: Ib3d8c3cf1c906c6e958650ad7b1a1942e5d9a9c3

added_lines: #!/bin/bash # # lib/cinder_plugins/lustre # Configure the lustre driver # Enable with: # # CINDER_DRIVER=lustre # Dependencies: # # - ``functions`` file # - ``cinder`` configurations # configure_cinder_driver - make configuration changes, including those to other services # Save trace setting _XTRACE_CINDER_LUSTRE=$(set +o | grep xtrace) set +o xtrace # Defaults # -------- # Set up default directories # Entry Points # ------------ # configure_cinder_driver - Set config files, create data dirs, etc function configure_cinder_driver { # To use lustre, set the following in localrc: # CINDER_DRIVER=lustre # CINDER_LUSTRE_SHARES="192.168.1.2@tcp:/lustre" # Shares are <host>:<volume> and separated by semicolons. iniset $CINDER_CONF DEFAULT volume_driver "cinder.volume.drivers.lustre.LustreDriver" iniset $CINDER_CONF DEFAULT lustre_shares_config "$CINDER_CONF_DIR/lustre_shares" touch $CINDER_CONF_DIR/lustre_shares if [ ! -z "$CINDER_LUSTRE_SHARES" ]; then echo "$CINDER_LUSTRE_SHARES" > $CINDER_CONF_DIR/lustre_shares fi } # Restore xtrace $_XTRACE_CINDER_LUSTRE # Local variables: # mode: shell-script # End:

commit_message:
Add lustre mount type support

As Lustre cinder driver is going to be added, lustre
unit test need be aware of new mount type.

Closes-Bug: #1641792

commit_message:
Add cinder Driver for Lustre

Lustre is a type of parallel distributed file system,
generally used for HPC Site.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lustre_(file_system)

However, there is no support from openstack cinder
for Lustre. The inital implement of Lustre cinder
pasted from GlusterFs with some adjustments, we tested
using nosetests under tempest/api/volume/admin/test_volume_*.py
and tempest/api/volume/test_volume_*.py.

Change-Id: I5498c72c3bbb21b3b2ffd0a6842bea76c829683b
Signed-off-by: Li Xi <lixi@ddn.com>
Signed-off-by: Wang Shilong <wshilong@ddn.com>

commit_message:
Octavia Feature Classification

The feature classification matrix will provide information about
plugins/drivers and the features they support.
Acts as a launching point for users to read about the intent
of the matrix before reviewing the matrix to find features and plugins
that meet their needs.

For those reviewing:
In order to test and see what it looks like, in octavia directory
run 'tox -e docs && python -m SimpleHTTPServer' to build the docs
locally.

Based off of the common core framework that is in flight.
Which will soon become its own library.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/330027/

Change-Id: I63dc2117556a2be40f5f9e784b8ba4421f587f03
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/77/451177/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ============ Introduction ============ This document describes how features are listed in :doc:`general_feature_support_matrix`. Goals ~~~~~ The object of this document is to inform users whether or not features are complete, well documented, stable, and tested. This approach ensures good user experience for those well maintained features. .. note:: Tests are specific to particular combinations of technologies. The plugins chosen for deployment make a big difference to whether or not features will work. Concepts ~~~~~~~~ These definitions clarify the terminology used throughout this document. Feature status ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ * Immature * Mature * Required * Deprecated (scheduled to be removed in a future release) Immature -------- Immature features do not have enough functionality to satisfy real world use cases. An immature feature is a feature being actively developed, which is only partially functional and upstream tested, most likely introduced in a recent release, and that will take time to mature thanks to feedback from downstream QA. Users of these features will likely identify gaps and/or defects that were not identified during specification and code review. Mature ------ A feature is considered mature if it satisfies the following criteria: * Complete API documentation including concept and REST call definition. * Complete Administrator documentation. * Tempest tests that define the correct functionality of the feature. * Enough functionality and reliability to be useful in real world scenarios. * Low probability of support for the feature being dropped. Required -------- Required features are core load balancing principles that have been thoroughly tested and have been implemented in real world use cases. In addition they satisfy the same criteria for any mature features. .. note:: Any new drivers must prove that they support all required features before they are merged into octavia. Deprecated ---------- Deprecated features are no longer supported and only security related fixes or development will happen towards them. Deployment rating of features ----------------------------- The deployment rating shows only the state of the tests for each feature on a particular deployment. .. important:: Despite the obvious parallels that could be drawn, this list is unrelated to the DefCore effort. See `InteropWG <https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Governance/InteropWG>`_

commit_message:
Add host field to instance action event

Record the host where the action event occurs on, provide convenient to
admins to find the error log efficiently.

Add a new microversion to GET
/servers/{servier_id}/os-instance-actions/{request_id}, modify the
response, for admin (policy check) it will show the hostname. If not
admin, show the obfuscated-hashed-compute-id thing that we already show on
instance (for non-admin users).

APIImpact

Change-Id: Ia8779a5acb928dfba40a261e4c434cc1c1a9e674
Implements: blueprint add-host-field-to-instance-action-event
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/11/550411/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================================= Add host field to instance action event ======================================= Currently, the ``instance action event`` record does not include the ``host`` information of the action event occurs. Including this field to the ``instance action event`` record will make it easier for admins to locate where error happens and be able to solve the problem faster. https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/add-host-field-to-instance-action-event Problem description =================== Currently, the ``instance action event`` record does not include the ``host`` information of the action event occurs. For failure events, in order to solve the problems, operators have to figure out on what host did the error happened. It will be much more easier for operators to do this if ``host`` field is recorded in the action event records. Use Cases --------- As an operator, I want to quickly allocate where and why instance action failure happened. If ``instance action event`` details can provide where it occurs on, it provide convenient to operators to find the error log efficiently. Proposed change =============== * Add a new ``host`` field to ``InstanceActionEvent`` object, to record the host that the event occurs on. * Add a new microversion to ``GET /servers/{server_id}/os=instance-actions/{req_id}`` API to include the ``host`` field for admin and an ``obfuscated-hashed-host-id`` for non-admin users. .. note:: ``host`` field is already existing in DB model, so no need to add an upgrade script. Alternatives ------------ Leave it as is. Data model impact ----------------- Add a new ``host`` field to ``InstanceActionEvent`` object, to record the host that the event occurs on. REST API impact --------------- Add a new microversion to ``GET /servers/{server_id}/os=instance-actions/{req_id}`` API to include the ``host`` field for admin and an ``obfuscated-hashed-host-id`` for non-admin users. * For admin users: { "instanceAction": { "action": "stop", "events": [ { "event": "compute_stop_instance", "finish_time": "2017-12-07T11:07:06.431902", "result": "Success", "start_time": "2017-12-07T11:07:06.251280", "traceback": null, "host": "host1" } ], "instance_uuid": "b48316c5-71e8-45e4-9884-6c78055b9b13", "message": "", "project_id": "6f70656e737461636b20342065766572", "request_id": "req-3293a3f1-b44c-4609-b8d2-d81b105636b8", "start_time": "2017-12-07T11:07:06.088644", "updated_at": "2017-12-07T11:07:06.431902", "user_id": "fake" } } * For non-admin users: { "instanceAction": { "action": "stop", "events": [ { "event": "compute_stop_instance", "finish_time": "2017-12-07T11:07:06.431902", "result": "Success", "start_time": "2017-12-07T11:07:06.251280", "host": "1234567890" } ], "instance_uuid": "b48316c5-71e8-45e4-9884-6c78055b9b13", "message": "", "project_id": "6f70656e737461636b20342065766572", "request_id": "req-3293a3f1-b44c-4609-b8d2-d81b105636b8", "start_time": "2017-12-07T11:07:06.088644", "updated_at": "2017-12-07T11:07:06.431902", "user_id": "fake" } } Security impact --------------- The display of newly added ``host`` field will be controlled by the same policy of ``traceback`` field, if the user is prevented by policy an obfuscated-hashed-host-id will be displayed instead of hostname. Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Yikun Jiang Other contributors: Kevin Zheng Work Items ---------- * Add a new ``host`` field to ``InstanceActionEvent`` object, to record the host that the event occurs on. * Add a new microversion to ``GET /servers/{server_id}/os=instance-actions/{req_id}`` API to include the ``host`` field for admin and an ``obfuscated-hashed-host-id`` for non-admin users. * Adopt the new microversion in python-novaclient. * Add related tests. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Need functional tests for the new path. Documentation Impact ==================== Update the api reference to include this change. References ========== None History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Rocky - Introduced

subject: Add request_id filed to InstanceAction versioned notifications
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-12 12:15:46.000000000', 'files': ['specs/rocky/approved/add-request-id-to-instance-action-notifications.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs/commit/c6604dc01a55b294799b5736f4b6cc73e2eb6c87', 'message': 'Add request_id filed to InstanceAction versioned notifications

Currently, it is mandatory to provide ``request_id`` when query instance
action details. Some of the long workflow, for example migrations, does
not store ``request_id`` in DB, the only way we can do it now is to use
timestamp filtering for instance action record to get the most suited
action records.

This spec proposes to extend the ``InstanceActionPayload`` versioned
object with a new ``request_id`` field and populate the ``request_id``
from the ``context`` object for emitting the instance action

Implement: blueprint add-request-id-to-instance-action-notifications

Change-Id: I24bdfe6c71777d1722db46a093745e561686301b
'}]
commit_message:
Add request_id filed to InstanceAction versioned notifications

Currently, it is mandatory to provide ``request_id`` when query instance
action details. Some of the long workflow, for example migrations, does
not store ``request_id`` in DB, the only way we can do it now is to use
timestamp filtering for instance action record to get the most suited
action records.

This spec proposes to extend the ``InstanceActionPayload`` versioned
object with a new ``request_id`` field and populate the ``request_id``
from the ``context`` object for emitting the instance action
notifications.

Implement: blueprint add-request-id-to-instance-action-notifications

Change-Id: I24bdfe6c71777d1722db46a093745e561686301b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/82/551982/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================================== Add request_id filed to InstanceAction versioned notifications ============================================================== It was agreed on Rocky PTG[1] that it is useful to have the ``request_id`` in the instance action versioned notification payload. It could help the operators to connect the state change described in the notification with the user actions and API request. https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/add-request-id-to-instance-action-notifications Problem description =================== Currently, it is mandatory to provide ``request_id`` when query instance action details. Some of the long workflow, for example migrations, does not store ``request_id`` in DB, the only way we can do it now is to use timestamp filtering for instance action record to get the most suited action records. This spec proposes to extend the ``InstanceActionPayload`` versioned object with a new ``request_id`` field and populate the ``request_id`` from the ``context`` object for emitting the instance action notifications. Use Cases --------- As an operator, I want to have a way to easily connect the state change described in the notification with the user actions and API request. Proposed change =============== This spec proposes to extend the ``InstanceActionPayload`` versioned object with a new ``request_id`` field and populate the ``request_id`` from the ``context`` object for emitting the instance action notifications. Alternatives ------------ We could leave it as is and use timestamp filter to get what we want. As for the migrations usecase, we could add ``request_id`` field to ``migrations`` object, by this way the ``request_id`` for all migrations will be persistent in DB and available for both admin and operators. Data model impact ----------------- The ``InstanceActionPayload`` object will be bumped to a new version to extend the ``request_id`` field:: class InstanceActionPayload(InstancePayload): ... # Version 1.6: Added request_id field to InstanceActionPayload VERSION = '1.5' fields = { 'fault': fields.ObjectField('ExceptionPayload', nullable=True), 'request_id': fields.StringField(nullable=True), } REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- All instance action notifications will send out versioned notification with extended ``request_id`` field. Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Kevin Zheng Work Items ---------- * Extend the InstanceActionPayload to include the ``request_id`` field. * Modify related unit tests and functional tests Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Related functional tests will be updated. Documentation Impact ==================== Need to update the developer docs. References ========== [1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/nova-ptg-rocky L391 [2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/5d2add74534719c5670b29152964a60e8f23b42b/nova/notifications/objects/instance.py#L125 History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Rocky - Introduced

commit_message:
Make fullstack and functional native Zuul v3 jobs

As part of the migration to Zuul v3 jobs should be converted to native
versions. This patch uses `devstack`'s native job to provide a base
for the functional and fullstack tests.

Change-Id: I2fb7e7e1a6c79c8e2edb0c0bff795d61881f2cd5
Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539683/
Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539686/

subject: Update G-R for pyOpenSSL>=17.1.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-12 21:37:21.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'lower-constraints.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/e509d4d08d8e078794dd51ad02fcbf20d2f3d3f5', 'message': 'Update G-R for pyOpenSSL>=17.1.0

Octavia is using the new to_cryptography()[1] feature of pyOpenSSL[2] which is
only present from 17.1.0 forward. Upper-constraints is already at 17.5.0 so
we would like to bump the global-requirements and lower-constraints to a
minimum of 17.1.0.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/master/octavia/certificates/ \
    common/pkcs12.py#L35
[2] https://pyopenssl.org/en/stable/api/crypto.html#OpenSSL.crypto.X509. \
    to_cryptography

Change-Id: I2722988cc1366b6b10a4c949b25f2671b481ee59
'}]
commit_message:
Update G-R for pyOpenSSL>=17.1.0

Octavia is using the new to_cryptography()[1] feature of pyOpenSSL[2] which is
only present from 17.1.0 forward. Upper-constraints is already at 17.5.0 so
we would like to bump the global-requirements and lower-constraints to a
minimum of 17.1.0.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/master/octavia/certificates/ \
    common/pkcs12.py#L35
[2] https://pyopenssl.org/en/stable/api/crypto.html#OpenSSL.crypto.X509. \
    to_cryptography

Change-Id: I2722988cc1366b6b10a4c949b25f2671b481ee59

commit_message:
ironic-conductor: mount /var/lib/config-data/ironic_conductor/

Mount /var/lib/config-data/ironic_conductor/ from /etc/ironic,
so if ironic-conductor is separated from ironic-api, operators can
still read config in /var/lib/condif-data.

Change-Id: I457c87392e97e0697fc911834cd2c2c118429e8b

commit_message:
use plugin common utils from neutron-lib

The public APIs that are part of neutron.plugins.common.utils were
rehomed into neutron-lib with Iabb155b5d2d0ec6104ebee5dd42cf292bdf3ec61
and will removed in neutron with commit
I1d63cbea463e92e1d2e053f8e1a564ed52cb84f8

This patch consumes the common plugin utils from neutron-lib

NOTE: We'll have to rehome the create_port and related functions
before we can remove the utils from neutron as noted into the TODO.

Change-Id: I89d2256e6da79bede72dc4e1d87a80da799834b8

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 14.2.17

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: I212a2808dc9d4cfb466fd5b6adc45d9e85da4212
Change-Id: I24f3ebbb498bd5c2a4ca3416e9bde4feb77f86c8

commit_message:
Revert "Do not start conntrack worker thread from __init__"

This reverts commit 4c8b97eca32c9c2beadf95fef14ed5b7d8981c5a.

After further testing it was found this did not fix the issue.

Change-Id: Ib9c4ac25752d2f68973c3615111f9f14b152d340
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/39/551339/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from six.moves import queue as Queue self._queue = Queue.Queue() update = self._queue.get() yield update self.start_process_queue() def start_process_queue(self):
deleted_lines: self._queue = eventlet.queue.LightQueue() try: update = self._queue.get() yield update except IndexError: # queue was empty, another worker stole our entry continue except Exception as e: LOG.error("Failed to yield ip_conntrack process queue " "entry: %s", e) # Don't start the queue processing thread here, do later when # the first entry is added to the queue. self._process_queue_started = False def _start_process_queue(self): if not self._process_queue_started: self._process_queue_started = True self._start_process_queue()

added_lines: self.test_object.os_ironic_api_min_version = None self.test_object.os_ironic_api_max_version = None def test_negotiate_server_user_latest_max( self, mock_pvh, mock_msr, mock_save_data): mock_pvh.return_value = ('1.1', '1.99') mock_conn = mock.MagicMock() max_ver = '1.30' self.test_object.api_version_select_state = 'user' self.test_object.os_ironic_api_max_version = max_ver self.test_object.os_ironic_api_version = 'latest' result = self.test_object.negotiate_version(mock_conn, None) self.assertEqual(max_ver, result) self.assertEqual('negotiated', self.test_object.api_version_select_state) self.assertEqual(max_ver, self.test_object.os_ironic_api_version) self.assertTrue(mock_msr.called) self.assertEqual(1, mock_pvh.call_count) self.assertEqual(1, mock_save_data.call_count) @mock.patch.object(filecache, 'save_data', autospec=True) @mock.patch.object(http.VersionNegotiationMixin, '_make_simple_request', autospec=True) @mock.patch.object(http.VersionNegotiationMixin, '_parse_version_headers', autospec=True) def test_negotiate_server_user_latest_max_unsupported( self, mock_pvh, mock_msr, mock_save_data): mock_pvh.return_value = ('1.10', '1.26') mock_conn = mock.MagicMock() self.test_object.api_version_select_state = 'user' self.test_object.os_ironic_api_version = 'latest' self.test_object.os_ironic_api_max_version = '1.5' self.assertRaises(ValueError, self.test_object.negotiate_version, mock_conn, None) self.test_object.os_ironic_api_max_version = '1.30' self.assertRaises(ValueError, self.test_object.negotiate_version, mock_conn, None) @mock.patch.object(filecache, 'save_data', autospec=True) @mock.patch.object(http.VersionNegotiationMixin, '_make_simple_request', autospec=True) @mock.patch.object(http.VersionNegotiationMixin, '_parse_version_headers', autospec=True)

Add swift-slogging project under swift

Current slogging is managed in PTL John's GItHub.

this repository as one of OpenStack official one.
This change aims to proceed this activity.

commit_message:
Apply remote metadata in _handle_sync_response

We've already got it in the response, may as well apply it now rather
than wait for the other end to get around to running its replicators.

Change-Id: Ie36a6dd075beda04b9726dfa2bba9ffed025c9ef

commit_message:
Pin puppet-systemd

puppet-systemd recently added a breaking change to pull the module
parameter defaults via hiera. This only works in puppet >= 4.10.0 which
we are not using. So we need to pin to an earlier commit since we're
usign 4.8.x.

Change-Id: I11c8372eb20d9ff67bcc91897118061d7f193a54
Closes-Bug: #1755211

commit_message:
Treat enable_debug in Ansible as a bool

Without the extra bool this when block gets evaluated as a string.
Given that it is always present this means enable_debug has been
enabled regardless of the end user setting.

Change-Id: I9f53f3bca4a6862966e558ea20fe001eabda7bcf
Closes-bug: #1754481

commit_message:
Add role_specific tag to missing role-specific parameters

A tag 'role_specific' should be added to the parameters of
a service which are accepted as role-specific. Adding the tag
for some of the missing parameters.

Change-Id: Ic205b4c6cf219f37025e6ddb61455e1d48ec480d

subject: Make exposing the keystone admin port optional
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-12 11:33:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/b19eccaf357b6a500af6b090bff0ac64edd71d0a', 'message': "Make exposing the keystone admin port optional

A recent commit [1] removed the exposure of the keystone admin port for
the public interface. While this removal was intended, it was not ideal
to backport it to stable/newton as some folks were relying on this port
being available.

This commit then adds a flag to expose or hide the keystone admin
endpoint from the public network. It's on by default to keep the

commit_message:
Make exposing the keystone admin port optional

A recent commit [1] removed the exposure of the keystone admin port for
the public interface. While this removal was intended, it was not ideal
to backport it to stable/newton as some folks were relying on this port
being available.

This commit then adds a flag to expose or hide the keystone admin
endpoint from the public network. It's on by default to keep the
functionality that folks with newton were seeing; but it lets folks opt
out of it if needed (as is the case is some deployments).

[1] I79563f62fd49a4f7654779157ebda3c239d6dd22

Closes-Bug: #1748872
Change-Id: I865aff9d54ebbe6acc44ffca41c951a05da71218

commit_message:
Simplify SELinux check

The ansible_selinux variable is always populated with a 'status'
property, even if SELinux is not installed or configured. This
patch simplifies the check.
